definition[0]: to control an activity or process, especially by rules
example[0]: strict rules regulating the use of chemicals in food
definition[1]: to make a machine or your body work at a particular speed, temperature etc
example[1]: People sweat to regulate their body heat.
definition[2]: to check that business activities, financial activities etc are legal and fair
example[2]: The Personal Investment Authority regulates the selling of ISAs to the public.
example[3]: Many futures exchanges are closely regulated.
example[4]: The City has so far failed to regulate itself effectively.
